attributes.comment:
I am opposed to the increase in fees pertaining to the adoption of childres and
recommend that the fees for adoption should be held because, for many of us, we
have to file TWICE because the approval is only good for 18 months. With
adoptions taking longer and longer, most of us have to file again as they agency
does not permit us to renew our filing. We are required to pay the full price again!

Here is what it costs to file with USCIS for a single person just to adopt:

What it used to be when adoptions took place within 18 months:

I600A: $545

Fingerprints: $70

Total: $615

What it will be now that adoptions are taking longer plus the increase:

I600A: $670 x 2 = 1340

Fingerprints: $80 x 2 = $160

Total: $1500

That's an increase of $885 or over 140%! That's how much more USCIS will
make on just us, adopting parents, with no increase in services.

And that's not even taking into consideration the fact that applying
for our children's Certificate of Citizenship (for IR4 visas) goes from $215 to
$460, a difference of $245 or about 120% increase. Sometimes, we don't
even get the certificates for a year after filing!

If you feel the need to increase the fees, then, at least, increase the service to
match.

Sincerely,
K. Thomas
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Kimberly Thomas
